intro: Rapanea hartii, commonly known as the African ebony, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by black, berry-like fruits. Rapanea hartii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
